newsitem.title: USA: Christopher meets Clinton in Little Rock.
newsitem.headline: Christopher meets Clinton in Little Rock.

text.p: Secretary of State Warren Christopher flew on Tuesday from Washington to Little Rock, Arkansas, to meet with President Bill Clinton, who was awaiting election results.
State Department spokesman Nicholas Burns said Christopher made the trip at Clinton's request and that the two men had a "variety of things" to talk about.
Burns said foreign policy issues were on the agenda and did not rule out the possibility that Christopher's future may also be discussed. But he refused to give any details.
It is widely expected that Christopher, who just turned 71, will not serve a second term if Clinton is re-elected, as many predict.
Speculation on a successor has included U.N. Ambassador Madeleine Albright, former Sen. George Mitchell, National Security Adviser Anthony Lake and others.
